publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-5569 Murray Tosh: Investment in Building Affordable Rented Homes—That the Parliament acknowledges the need for increased investment in building affordable rented homes; further acknowledges that the 2007 Comprehensive Spending Review is the most significant opportunity to secure this funding, which is essential to achieve the Scottish Executive’s target that all unintentionally homeless people will have the right to a home by 2012, and recognises the case for committing the funding for 30,000 affordable homes for rent over the period 2008 to 2011.

S2M-5569 Murray Tosh: Investment in Building Affordable Rented Homes—That the Parliament acknowledges the need for increased investment in building affordable rented homes; further acknowledges that the 2007 Comprehensive Spending Review is the most significant opportunity to secure this funding, which is essential to achieve the Scottish Executive’s target that all unintentionally homeless people will have the right to a home by 2012, and recognises the case for committing the funding for 30,000 affordable homes for rent over the period 2008 to 2011.

S2M-5569 Investment in Building Affordable Rented Homes (lodged on 8 February 2007) Rob Gibson*, Alex Fergusson*, Patrick Harvie*, Dave Petrie*, Mr David Davidson*, Mrs Nanette Milne*, Mr Mark Ruskell*, Mike Rumbles*, John Home Robertson*, Margaret Mitchell*, Brian Adam*, Dr Elaine Murray*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Trish Godman*, Eleanor Scott*, Frances Curran*, Robin Harper*

S2M-5569 Investment in Building Affordable Rented Homes (lodged on 8 February 2007) Shiona Baird*, Chris Ballance*, Tommy Sheridan*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Ms Sandra White*, Carolyn Leckie*, Rosie Kane*, Maureen Macmillan*, Jim Mather*

S2M-5569 Investment in Building Affordable Rented Homes (lodged on 8 February 2007) Stewart Stevenson*, Dr Jean Turner*

S2M-5569 Investment in Building Affordable Rented Homes (lodged on 8 February 2007) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Malcolm Chisholm*

S2M-5569 Investment in Building Affordable Rented Homes (lodged on 8 February 2007) Mr Jamie Stone* Contents An A B C D E F G H I J

S2M-5569 Murray Tosh: Investment in Building Affordable Rented Homes—That the Parliament acknowledges the need for increased investment in building affordable rented homes; further acknowledges that the 2007 Comprehensive Spending Review is the most significant opportunity to secure this funding, which is essential to achieve the Scottish Executive’s target that all unintentionally homeless people will have the right to a home by 2012, and recognises the case for committing the funding for 30,000 affordable homes for rent over the period 2008 to 2011. Supported by: Rob Gibson, Alex Fergusson, Patrick Harvie, Dave Petrie, Mr David Davidson, Mrs Nanette Milne, Mr Mark Ruskell, Mike Rumbles, John Home Robertson, Margaret Mitchell, Brian Adam, Dr Elaine Murray, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Trish Godman, Eleanor Scott, Frances Curran, Robin Harper, Shiona Baird, Chris Ballance, Tommy Sheridan, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Ms Sandra White, Carolyn Leckie, Rosie Kane, Maureen Macmillan, Jim Mather, Mark Ballard, Susan Deacon, Alex Johnstone, John Swinburne, Mr Stewart Maxwell, John Farquhar Munro, Donald Gorrie, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Colin Fox, Alasdair Morgan, Stewart Stevenson, Dr Jean Turner, Jackie Baillie, Mike Pringle, Richard Baker, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Malcolm Chisholm, Pauline McNeill, Richard Lochhead, Mr Andrew Welsh, John Scott, Mr Jamie Stone
